label: 下司
本: State of War: the Violent Order of Fourteenth Century Japan . Michigan University Press . 2003
説明文: A local manager, appointed to an estate (shōen), who could be removed from his office by the proprietor. In such cases, the disgruntled gesu would frequently become an akutō. Kamakura replaced many of these offices with that of jitō during the late twelfth and early thirteenth centuries. [荘園、悪党、地頭]
